summary: App to sell the user's engineering books and notes via a simple storefront with upload/listing, pricing, and purchasing.

existing_features.title: Create a public storefront UI that lists all published products with search and basic filters (e.g., type: book/note), and a product detail page with description, price, and a clear purchase action.
Add authentication in the UI using Internet Identity, showing different navigation/actions for: (a) public visitors, (b) signed-in buyers (purchases/downloads), and (c) owner/admin (manage products).
Create an admin dashboard UI for the owner to manage products: create product, edit fields (title/description/type/price/currency), publish/unpublish, delete, and upload/replace the associated file.
Create a buyer library UI for signed-in users that lists purchased products and provides a download button for each purchased item.

Use React Query for all backend calls (products, purchases, entitlements) with loading/error states and optimistic or refetch behavior where appropriate after mutations (create/update/publish/purchase/upload).

Apply a coherent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, and components) with a clean, technical editorial style suitable for engineering materials; enforce the theme consistently across storefront, product pages, admin dashboard, and buyer library.
Generate and include static marketing/brand images for the storefront (logo and a hero/banner illustration) and render them from frontend static assets.

Add a clear in-app way for the user to specify what they want to update by adding a simple "Request an update" action in the UI (e.g., in the footer or header) that opens a modal with a freeform text field and a "Copy to clipboard" button so the user can share exact update instructions.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a storefront app to upload engineering books/notes, set prices, and allow visitors to purchase/download.

Implement backend data models and APIs to manage digital products (engineering books and notes), including: create/update/delete product, list products for storefront, get product details, and store pricing and publication status (draft/published).

Add backend support for uploading and downloading the actual digital files for each product (e.g., PDF), and restrict file access so only the owner (admin) can upload/replace files, while buyers can download only after purchase entitlement is granted.

Implement backend purchase flow and entitlements: allow an authenticated user to create a purchase record for a product at the current price, and grant that user an entitlement that unlocks the download for that product.

Implement an owner/admin role based on a single configured owner principal (the canister controller/installer by default) to control product management actions (create/update/delete/publish and file upload).
